title: How to Make a Smoothie for Your Rabbit

steps.headline: Cut up the strawberries without the stems.
steps.description: Do the same for all the other fruits.

steps.headline: Measure out the juice.
steps.description: If you use less juice, than the smoothie will be thicker.

steps.headline: Set up the blender or juice maker.
steps.description: Plug it in and be sure that all the pieces are in place.

steps.headline: Combine all the ingredients in the blender.
Blend on high till all items are completely blended.
Feed your rabbit the smoothie.
steps.description: Provide a shallow dish to place the smoothie in. Remember: only 1 teaspoon of sweets (including smoothies) per every 2lbs the rabbit weighs.

steps.headline: Store the rest of the smoothie for the rest of the week.

tyn: Another dish for refrigerating the smoothie
text: Prepare your ingredients.  Cut up the strawberries without the stems. Do the same for all the other fruits. Measure out the juice. If you use less juice, than the smoothie will be thicker. Set up the blender or juice maker. Plug it in and be sure that all the pieces are in place. Combine all the ingredients in the blender.  Blend on high till all items are completely blended.  Feed your rabbit the smoothie. Provide a shallow dish to place the smoothie in. Remember: only 1 teaspoon of sweets (including smoothies) per every 2lbs the rabbit weighs. Store the rest of the smoothie for the rest of the week.
sentences: Cut up the strawberries without the stems.
Do the same for all the other fruits.
If you use less juice, than the smoothie will be thicker.
Set up the blender or juice maker.
Plug it in and be sure that all the pieces are in place.
Combine all the ingredients in the blender.
Blend on high till all items are completely blended.
Provide a shallow dish to place the smoothie in.
Remember: only 1 teaspoon of sweets (including smoothies) per every 2lbs the rabbit weighs.
Store the rest of the smoothie for the rest of the week.
